intro: Anil macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered anil, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has hairy, glandular leaves that help it adapt to its harsh environment. Its fruit is a dry capsule that contains several small, black seeds. Anil macrocalyx is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
